data:
1
00:00:16,057 --> 00:00:18,351
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,894 --> 00:00:22,772
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,772 --> 00:00:25,567
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:26,609 --> 00:00:29,279
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:29,362 --> 00:00:34,617
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:34,617 --> 00:00:37,287
They called this ability
"Tuning."

7
00:00:38,455 --> 00:00:40,290
But they were dying.

8
00:00:40,373 --> 00:00:43,418
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:43,418 --> 00:00:46,129
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:46,212 --> 00:00:48,882
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:50,258 --> 00:00:53,720
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:53,803 --> 00:00:55,889
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:56,931 --> 00:00:58,391
Our world.

14
00:00:59,434 --> 00:01:01,436
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:01,478 --> 00:01:03,438
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:14,240 --> 00:01:17,118
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:18,119 --> 00:01:19,788
I am just a man.

18
00:01:19,829 --> 00:01:22,624
I help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:24,167 --> 00:01:26,252
I have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:53,668 --> 00:04:55,503
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:55,545 --> 00:04:58,340
Frightened. That's all right.
I can help you.

22
00:04:58,340 --> 00:04:59,966
-Who is this?
-I'm a doctor.

23
00:05:00,008 --> 00:05:02,719
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:05:02,719 --> 00:05:04,888
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:05:04,888 --> 00:05:07,057
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:05:07,140 --> 00:05:09,184
No, I don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:05:09,225 --> 00:05:12,020
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:12,062 --> 00:05:14,356
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:15,565 --> 00:05:17,734
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:05:59,901 --> 00:06:02,362
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:06:02,404 --> 00:06:03,905
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:06:04,948 --> 00:06:08,576
I suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:06:08,618 --> 00:06:10,412
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:06:12,455 --> 00:06:13,957
I've been here three weeks?

35
00:06:13,957 --> 00:06:17,127
It's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:17,127 --> 00:06:19,587
Day and date.

37
00:06:19,629 --> 00:06:22,924
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:22,966 --> 00:06:25,969
-I'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:25,969 --> 00:06:28,138
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:28,138 --> 00:06:29,556
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:47,449 --> 00:06:50,160
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:50,160 --> 00:06:52,746
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:07:03,673 --> 00:07:07,302
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:07:07,344 --> 00:07:10,805
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:07:12,182 --> 00:07:13,933
Sleep now.

46
00:07:16,519 --> 00:07:20,523
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:20,607 --> 00:07:22,776
Dance with me

48
00:07:22,817 --> 00:07:25,862
Make me sway

49
00:07:25,862 --> 00:07:29,866
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:29,866 --> 00:07:32,118
Hold me close

51
00:07:32,160 --> 00:07:35,038
Sway me more

52
00:07:35,038 --> 00:07:39,334
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:39,376 --> 00:07:41,795
Bend with me

54
00:07:41,836 --> 00:07:44,673
Sway with ease

55
00:07:44,714 --> 00:07:48,677
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:48,718 --> 00:07:51,179
Stay with me

57
00:07:51,179 --> 00:07:53,723
Sway with me

58
00:07:54,557 --> 00:07:58,561
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:07:58,645 --> 00:08:00,188
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:20,417 --> 00:08:21,668
Excuse me.

61
00:08:23,586 --> 00:08:25,171
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:25,255 --> 00:08:29,259
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:30,593 --> 00:08:34,014
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:34,055 --> 00:08:35,515
What is this?

65
00:08:35,557 --> 00:08:39,102
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:39,185 --> 00:08:42,856
I don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:42,897 --> 00:08:45,442
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:45,442 --> 00:08:48,278
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:48,278 --> 00:08:49,779
for quite some time.

70
00:08:49,779 --> 00:08:53,116
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:53,199 --> 00:08:56,244
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:56,286 --> 00:08:58,204
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:08:59,581 --> 00:09:01,875
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:09:01,916 --> 00:09:04,794
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:09:04,794 --> 00:09:07,297
He was very angry at me.

76
00:09:07,380 --> 00:09:10,216
I understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:09:10,258 --> 00:09:11,593
but for John's sake,

78
00:09:11,634 --> 00:09:14,596
I would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:09:14,637 --> 00:09:18,266
It appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:09:18,308 --> 00:09:21,436
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:09:21,478 --> 00:09:24,439
Oh, but I am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:24,481 --> 00:09:25,774
Even violent.

83
00:09:27,108 --> 00:09:31,071
If he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:31,112 --> 00:09:33,573
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:35,325 --> 00:09:36,493
For himself.

86
00:09:46,670 --> 00:09:50,590
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:51,508 --> 00:09:55,011
Mr. "J" something Murdoch?

88
00:09:58,348 --> 00:10:02,519
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:10:06,856 --> 00:10:08,942
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:10:08,983 --> 00:10:11,528
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:10:17,867 --> 00:10:19,661
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:43,727 --> 00:10:47,147
I told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:47,188 --> 00:10:50,483
I said, "Listen,
three weeks is three weeks."

94
00:10:50,525 --> 00:10:54,070
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:55,363 --> 00:10:56,698
The call girl.

96
00:11:01,327 --> 00:11:04,247
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-Inspector Bumstead.

97
00:11:04,247 --> 00:11:05,999
Your lace is untied.

98
00:11:07,250 --> 00:11:08,501
Sorry.

99
00:11:16,926 --> 00:11:18,511
Am I glad you're here, sir.

100
00:11:18,553 --> 00:11:21,181
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:11:21,222 --> 00:11:23,391
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:54,297 --> 00:11:56,800
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:11:59,260 --> 00:12:01,054
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:12:01,805 --> 00:12:04,474
-You left your wallet here.
-When did I do that?

105
00:12:04,474 --> 00:12:06,726
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:12:06,768 --> 00:12:10,146
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:12:15,985 --> 00:12:18,738
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:36,131 --> 00:12:37,966
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:38,008 --> 00:12:39,300
And where's home?

110
00:12:39,342 --> 00:12:42,137
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:42,178 --> 00:12:44,431
I'm just doing my job, May.

112
00:12:44,472 --> 00:12:46,516
There's a killer out there.

113
00:12:46,516 --> 00:12:49,185
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:52,522 --> 00:12:54,274
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:13:03,199 --> 00:13:04,284
Come on.

116
00:13:07,537 --> 00:13:10,331
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:13:10,331 --> 00:13:13,209
-I believe so, sir.
-Give the man an "A" for effort.

118
00:13:18,673 --> 00:13:20,967
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:13:21,009 --> 00:13:27,474
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:13:27,515 --> 00:13:29,392
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:13:29,392 --> 00:13:32,729
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:32,729 --> 00:13:33,855
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:33,897 --> 00:13:35,690
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:35,732 --> 00:13:38,818
I've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:38,860 --> 00:13:41,071
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:41,071 --> 00:13:43,031
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:43,073 --> 00:13:44,866
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:44,908 --> 00:13:46,910
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:47,577 --> 00:13:48,745
Frank!

130
00:13:51,873 --> 00:13:53,917
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:53,917 --> 00:13:56,211
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:57,587 --> 00:13:59,339
God, can't you see?

133
00:14:02,759 --> 00:14:05,095
Let me go!
I'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:14:06,596 --> 00:14:08,848
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:14:17,232 --> 00:14:20,360
I'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:14:20,402 --> 00:14:24,739
What did I ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:14:24,739 --> 00:14:27,701
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:14:27,742 --> 00:14:29,119
should be here, so--

139
00:14:29,202 --> 00:14:31,788
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:14:34,124 --> 00:14:35,959
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:42,549 --> 00:14:45,885
I came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:45,927 --> 00:14:49,305
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:51,599 --> 00:14:53,268
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:56,312 --> 00:14:59,649
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:15:00,483 --> 00:15:02,485
Who are these women?

146
00:15:02,485 --> 00:15:04,404
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:15:04,446 --> 00:15:06,656
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:15:06,740 --> 00:15:10,285
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:15:11,661 --> 00:15:14,956
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:15:16,332 --> 00:15:19,669
Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry.
I didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:15:19,669 --> 00:15:22,464
I'm sorry that I came.
I just made a mistake.

152
00:15:22,505 --> 00:15:26,259
If you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:15:35,643 --> 00:15:36,853
We met before?

154
00:15:38,521 --> 00:15:41,608
If we did,
I hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:41,649 --> 00:15:43,193
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:46,988 --> 00:15:48,782
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:56,706 --> 00:15:57,999
I was just thinking.

158
00:16:02,212 --> 00:16:03,797
What you do...

159
00:16:05,006 --> 00:16:10,053
It seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:16:10,053 --> 00:16:12,055
How do you know
I'm not the killer?

161
00:16:12,055 --> 00:16:15,308
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:16:16,226 --> 00:16:18,478
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

163
00:16:30,573 --> 00:16:31,741
Shoot.

164
00:17:19,414 --> 00:17:23,251
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:17:23,293 --> 00:17:27,088
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

166
00:17:28,089 --> 00:17:30,300
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:55,825 --> 00:17:57,077
He can Tune!

168
00:18:50,213 --> 00:18:53,383
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:53,466 --> 00:18:56,553
-It is said he is able to Tune.
-Impossible!

170
00:18:56,636 --> 00:18:59,681
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:18:59,723 --> 00:19:02,559
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:19:02,559 --> 00:19:05,145
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:19:05,186 --> 00:19:08,857
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:19:08,898 --> 00:19:11,026
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:19:11,067 --> 00:19:14,821
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:19:14,863 --> 00:19:17,991
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:19:18,033 --> 00:19:20,660
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:19:24,039 --> 00:19:26,666
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:19:26,708 --> 00:19:29,586
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:19:30,587 --> 00:19:32,672
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:19:33,715 --> 00:19:36,593
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:19:36,593 --> 00:19:39,596
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:19:39,596 --> 00:19:41,848
We must have this man.

184
00:19:47,771 --> 00:19:48,938
My brand, I hope.

185
00:20:01,284 --> 00:20:02,869
I've been worried about you.

186
00:20:06,915 --> 00:20:08,249
Are you punishing me?

187
00:20:08,958 --> 00:20:11,628
If disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:20:11,628 --> 00:20:12,879
I don't appreciate it.

189
00:20:12,921 --> 00:20:14,089
What are you talking about?

190
00:20:17,592 --> 00:20:21,388
I found these keys in my pocket,
so I assume I live here.

191
00:20:23,556 --> 00:20:25,892
-You supposed to be my wife?
-"Supposed to be"?

192
00:20:29,437 --> 00:20:33,441
You really...don't know
who I am, do you.

193
00:20:34,317 --> 00:20:37,112
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:20:37,112 --> 00:20:38,446
My doctor?

195
00:20:41,324 --> 00:20:45,078
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:52,836 --> 00:20:54,838
Feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:54,838 --> 00:20:57,674
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

198
00:20:58,258 --> 00:20:59,759
I had an affair.

199
00:21:01,678 --> 00:21:03,013
You were angry at me.

200
00:21:06,182 --> 00:21:09,853
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:21:19,529 --> 00:21:21,865
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:21:21,948 --> 00:21:24,200
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:21:25,201 --> 00:21:29,372
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:21:30,206 --> 00:21:33,543
-I'm sorry. I--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:21:33,543 --> 00:21:36,546
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:21:36,546 --> 00:21:40,050
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:21:40,133 --> 00:21:42,802
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:21:42,844 --> 00:21:46,348
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:21:46,389 --> 00:21:48,516
I tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:21:48,558 --> 00:21:50,727
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:21:50,810 --> 00:21:54,022
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:54,022 --> 00:21:55,565
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:55,565 --> 00:21:58,318
I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:21:59,069 --> 00:22:00,737
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:22:00,820 --> 00:22:04,699
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:22:04,699 --> 00:22:07,744
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:22:07,827 --> 00:22:10,080
You will process
another template...

218
00:22:10,163 --> 00:22:12,207
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:22:12,248 --> 00:22:13,833
Of course.
I'll imprint him again.

220
00:22:15,418 --> 00:22:18,672
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:22:18,713 --> 00:22:21,508
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:22:21,549 --> 00:22:23,385
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:22:23,426 --> 00:22:26,346
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:22:26,388 --> 00:22:31,184
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:22:33,061 --> 00:22:34,729
The police were looking for you.

226
00:22:34,729 --> 00:22:36,898
I know. I saw the papers.

227
00:22:36,940 --> 00:22:39,442
"Killer stalks
city street-walkers."

228
00:22:43,071 --> 00:22:45,365
I was with one of those women.

229
00:22:46,908 --> 00:22:50,286
-Before I came here tonight.
-I don't understand.

230
00:22:50,370 --> 00:22:55,291
I met her outside an Automat.
I guess I wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:56,960 --> 00:23:00,422
I wanted to know if I had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:23:00,422 --> 00:23:01,923
Maybe I have lost my mind,

233
00:23:01,965 --> 00:23:04,968
but whoever I am, I'm still me,
and I'm not a killer.

234
00:23:10,974 --> 00:23:12,308
I believe you.

235
00:23:14,144 --> 00:23:15,395
You do?

236
00:23:19,941 --> 00:23:21,943
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:23:21,985 --> 00:23:23,445
The one you arrived in.

238
00:23:23,486 --> 00:23:25,780
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:23:27,949 --> 00:23:29,659
I didn't know he was still here.

240
00:23:33,288 --> 00:23:34,748
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:23:37,167 --> 00:23:40,170
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:23:40,170 --> 00:23:41,671
I didn't kill anyone.

243
00:23:41,671 --> 00:23:44,007
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:23:44,007 --> 00:23:47,260
Turn yourself in. I'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:23:47,302 --> 00:23:49,346
You won't believe
what I have to say.

246
00:23:50,513 --> 00:23:53,808
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:23:53,808 --> 00:23:57,479
It's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:23:57,479 --> 00:24:00,357
And I don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:24:00,357 --> 00:24:02,609
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:24:02,650 --> 00:24:05,153
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:24:09,491 --> 00:24:11,451
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:24:17,707 --> 00:24:18,792
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:25:01,710 --> 00:25:04,004
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:25:07,549 --> 00:25:09,926
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:25:09,926 --> 00:25:13,013
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:25:13,096 --> 00:25:15,598
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:25:18,560 --> 00:25:21,771
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:25:21,855 --> 00:25:24,941
I can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:25:25,025 --> 00:25:26,276
or the Crosstown.

260
00:25:30,947 --> 00:25:34,034
I'm sorry, lnspector,
I cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:25:34,117 --> 00:25:36,077
but I am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:25:36,119 --> 00:25:38,246
Well, I appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:25:46,963 --> 00:25:49,382
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:25:49,424 --> 00:25:53,970
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:25:53,970 --> 00:25:56,723
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:25:56,765 --> 00:25:59,934
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:25:59,976 --> 00:26:02,812
Well, I do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:26:02,896 --> 00:26:07,108
Inspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:26:07,108 --> 00:26:09,110
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:26:09,152 --> 00:26:13,114
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:26:13,156 --> 00:26:16,242
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:26:16,326 --> 00:26:18,578
Consumed by details.

273
00:26:18,620 --> 00:26:22,123
I would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:26:22,165 --> 00:26:24,751
Good evening, lnspector.
I really must be going.

275
00:27:02,539 --> 00:27:03,623
Come in.

276
00:27:08,628 --> 00:27:10,380
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:27:11,715 --> 00:27:14,342
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

278
00:27:20,724 --> 00:27:21,891
Come in, Frank.

279
00:27:25,186 --> 00:27:26,396
Close the door.

280
00:27:34,404 --> 00:27:37,741
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:27:37,741 --> 00:27:39,868
It's an interesting case.

282
00:27:40,994 --> 00:27:44,205
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:27:45,915 --> 00:27:49,544
-Or break it.
-Yeah. I was on that case.

284
00:27:49,586 --> 00:27:53,423
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:27:53,423 --> 00:27:54,883
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:27:55,925 --> 00:27:57,927
I've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:27:57,927 --> 00:27:59,888
riding in circles.

288
00:27:59,929 --> 00:28:03,433
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:28:05,727 --> 00:28:07,395
I've been over this entire city.

290
00:28:11,900 --> 00:28:13,777
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:28:13,777 --> 00:28:15,278
She's not my wife.

292
00:28:17,113 --> 00:28:20,116
I don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:28:20,116 --> 00:28:23,536
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:28:25,580 --> 00:28:27,082
As much as the next guy.

295
00:28:28,083 --> 00:28:30,794
See, I've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:28:30,877 --> 00:28:33,963
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:28:33,963 --> 00:28:36,132
But the more
I try to think back,

298
00:28:36,216 --> 00:28:39,219
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:28:39,260 --> 00:28:40,428
None of it seems real.

300
00:28:40,428 --> 00:28:44,599
It's like I've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:28:44,641 --> 00:28:47,602
and when I finally wake up,
I'll be somebody else,

302
00:28:47,644 --> 00:28:49,646
somebody totally different.

303
00:28:53,983 --> 00:28:56,152
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:28:57,320 --> 00:28:59,823
Something to do with the case.

305
00:29:00,448 --> 00:29:03,827
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:29:03,827 --> 00:29:07,789
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

307
00:29:48,830 --> 00:29:50,540
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:29:50,623 --> 00:29:53,877
12 family photo albums,

309
00:29:53,877 --> 00:29:56,338
nine personal diaries,

310
00:29:56,379 --> 00:29:58,506
17 love letters,

311
00:29:58,548 --> 00:30:00,967
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:30:01,009 --> 00:30:05,180
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:30:05,221 --> 00:30:07,515
These do bring back memories.

314
00:30:09,851 --> 00:30:12,145
This one is still warm.

315
00:30:12,896 --> 00:30:14,064
What is it?

316
00:30:14,064 --> 00:30:17,317
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:30:17,359 --> 00:30:19,652
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:30:20,362 --> 00:30:21,863
We will soon find out.

319
00:30:23,156 --> 00:30:24,657
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:30:24,699 --> 00:30:27,911
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:30:27,911 --> 00:30:32,248
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:30:33,041 --> 00:30:34,334
Let's see.

323
00:30:35,585 --> 00:30:38,338
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:30:44,010 --> 00:30:46,596
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:30:48,181 --> 00:30:51,267
And last but not least...

326
00:30:51,267 --> 00:30:53,895
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:30:56,731 --> 00:30:58,400
Mr. Book.

328
00:31:05,407 --> 00:31:08,952
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:31:09,035 --> 00:31:13,289
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:31:13,289 --> 00:31:14,541
A freak of nature.

331
00:31:14,582 --> 00:31:17,419
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:31:17,460 --> 00:31:19,379
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:31:19,421 --> 00:31:22,048
Isn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:31:22,090 --> 00:31:25,427
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:31:25,468 --> 00:31:28,304
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:31:28,388 --> 00:31:29,931
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:31:33,977 --> 00:31:35,895
It requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:31:35,937 --> 00:31:37,605
to master our gifts.

339
00:31:37,647 --> 00:31:39,441
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:31:39,482 --> 00:31:41,484
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:31:41,484 --> 00:31:42,652
Absurd, I know.

342
00:31:42,652 --> 00:31:44,988
What other explanation is there?

343
00:31:49,951 --> 00:31:51,119
It is time.

344
00:32:37,040 --> 00:32:38,500
Shut it down.

345
00:32:57,018 --> 00:33:00,146
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:33:00,188 --> 00:33:02,023
It's about time, dear.

347
00:33:52,782 --> 00:33:53,783
Hello?

348
00:34:02,083 --> 00:34:03,418
Wake up.

349
00:34:06,546 --> 00:34:08,048
Wake up!

350
00:34:18,099 --> 00:34:20,268
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:34:23,438 --> 00:34:26,274
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:37:06,101 --> 00:37:07,477
The Goodwins.

353
00:37:07,477 --> 00:37:09,479
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:37:09,562 --> 00:37:11,648
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:37:15,485 --> 00:37:17,737
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:37:47,851 --> 00:37:50,145
The rich get richer.

357
00:37:50,186 --> 00:37:52,272
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:37:52,355 --> 00:37:53,690
before the night
is through.

359
00:38:47,243 --> 00:38:49,204
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

360
00:38:49,245 --> 00:38:50,747
It's you.

361
00:38:50,747 --> 00:38:51,831
Hey, come on.

362
00:38:51,873 --> 00:38:54,000
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:38:54,042 --> 00:38:56,169
if that's what you are.

364
00:38:56,211 --> 00:38:57,671
Please, l--

365
00:38:57,712 --> 00:38:59,547
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:38:59,589 --> 00:39:01,925
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:39:02,008 --> 00:39:03,927
I can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:39:03,927 --> 00:39:06,763
Nothing. I want to help you.

369
00:39:06,763 --> 00:39:10,225
We cannot talk here.
If they see us together--

370
00:39:10,266 --> 00:39:13,103
I don't care.
I want some answers. Now!

371
00:39:13,186 --> 00:39:16,272
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:39:16,356 --> 00:39:17,440
Answer me!

373
00:39:22,570 --> 00:39:23,613
My God.

374
00:39:23,613 --> 00:39:26,700
-You really can do it.
-I did that?

375
00:39:26,741 --> 00:39:29,369
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:39:29,411 --> 00:39:31,371
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:39:31,413 --> 00:39:32,956
They call it "Tuning."

378
00:39:33,039 --> 00:39:34,958
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:39:35,041 --> 00:39:37,544
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:39:37,627 --> 00:39:40,380
but I can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:39:40,422 --> 00:39:44,384
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:39:47,721 --> 00:39:49,222
My glasses.

383
00:40:43,443 --> 00:40:45,779
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:40:45,820 --> 00:40:48,656
Iollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:40:48,698 --> 00:40:51,534
So I told Fredrickson
I was letting him go.

386
00:40:51,618 --> 00:40:53,620
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:40:54,329 --> 00:40:57,374
He attacked me.
I don't know where he's gone.

388
00:40:57,874 --> 00:41:01,878
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:41:01,878 --> 00:41:04,506
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:41:06,883 --> 00:41:13,348
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:41:14,391 --> 00:41:22,482
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:41:25,360 --> 00:41:32,200
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:41:33,827 --> 00:41:39,708
I'll know, believe me, I'll know

394
00:41:41,167 --> 00:41:44,671
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:41:44,713 --> 00:41:48,758
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:41:48,758 --> 00:41:51,761
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:41:51,845 --> 00:41:53,430
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:41:53,430 --> 00:41:55,348
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:41:55,390 --> 00:41:58,852
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:41:58,893 --> 00:42:02,105
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:42:02,188 --> 00:42:06,401
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:42:06,443 --> 00:42:08,403
He is becoming like us.

403
00:42:08,403 --> 00:42:11,865
So we must become like him.

404
00:42:12,782 --> 00:42:15,118
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:42:15,118 --> 00:42:18,872
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:42:20,874 --> 00:42:23,460
We must not do this.

407
00:42:23,460 --> 00:42:26,880
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:42:26,921 --> 00:42:29,758
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:42:29,799 --> 00:42:33,219
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:42:33,261 --> 00:42:34,471
will be known to us.

411
00:42:34,554 --> 00:42:39,642
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:42:39,726 --> 00:42:42,145
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:42:42,145 --> 00:42:44,898
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:42:44,939 --> 00:42:48,485
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:42:48,485 --> 00:42:50,153
Imprint.

416
00:42:55,575 --> 00:42:57,494
This may sting a bit.

417
00:43:33,988 --> 00:43:35,699
Is it done?

418
00:43:35,699 --> 00:43:38,159
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:43:38,201 --> 00:43:42,038
I have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:43:42,706 --> 00:43:44,290
"Johnny...

421
00:43:44,332 --> 00:43:48,336
"Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:43:48,378 --> 00:43:50,630
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:43:50,672 --> 00:43:52,507
"Stop by sometime.

424
00:43:52,549 --> 00:43:55,844
"We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:43:55,885 --> 00:43:58,179
"Love to Emma. Karl."

426
00:44:03,685 --> 00:44:04,644
Karl.

427
00:44:06,521 --> 00:44:08,189
Karl Harris.

428
00:44:16,364 --> 00:44:17,407
Harris.

429
00:44:25,707 --> 00:44:28,752
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:44:28,752 --> 00:44:30,045
Try the subway.

431
00:44:33,757 --> 00:44:35,258
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:44:35,258 --> 00:44:38,094
Been working here long?

433
00:44:38,178 --> 00:44:41,514
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:45:06,623 --> 00:45:09,584
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:45:43,827 --> 00:45:45,912
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:45:45,954 --> 00:45:47,789
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:45:47,831 --> 00:45:50,583
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:45:50,625 --> 00:45:53,128
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:45:53,169 --> 00:45:57,173
-This is irrational.
-Instincts are irrational.

440
00:45:57,257 --> 00:46:00,510
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:46:00,593 --> 00:46:03,847
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:46:03,847 --> 00:46:05,181
His job.

443
00:46:05,265 --> 00:46:07,308
He does not care about our job.

444
00:46:07,308 --> 00:46:10,145
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:46:10,186 --> 00:46:12,856
If you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:46:12,856 --> 00:46:16,192
If I were Murdoch...

447
00:46:18,028 --> 00:46:21,531
I would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:46:21,531 --> 00:46:23,616
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:46:25,160 --> 00:46:26,661
And then...

450
00:46:28,538 --> 00:46:32,000
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:46:35,003 --> 00:46:39,549
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:46:43,219 --> 00:46:45,347
All change,
platform three.

453
00:46:48,058 --> 00:46:49,142
All change?

454
00:46:49,184 --> 00:46:51,519
Excuse me, how do I get
to the end of the line?

455
00:46:51,519 --> 00:46:53,021
You want the Express.

456
00:47:05,575 --> 00:47:08,078
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:47:08,078 --> 00:47:09,412
That's the Express.

458
00:47:10,914 --> 00:47:12,874
There's no way out.

459
00:47:12,916 --> 00:47:15,710
You can't get out of the city.
I've tried.

460
00:47:16,836 --> 00:47:18,922
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:47:18,922 --> 00:47:20,590
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:47:20,674 --> 00:47:21,758
You're not a killer.

463
00:47:21,841 --> 00:47:24,552
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:47:24,594 --> 00:47:26,221
Iike everyone else here.

465
00:47:26,262 --> 00:47:28,181
-Who are you?
-I was a cop.

466
00:47:28,223 --> 00:47:31,351
At least in this life I was.

467
00:47:31,393 --> 00:47:34,229
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:47:34,270 --> 00:47:36,064
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:47:36,106 --> 00:47:38,775
I seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:47:38,858 --> 00:47:40,944
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:47:41,027 --> 00:47:42,278
How do you know all this?

472
00:47:42,362 --> 00:47:44,114
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:47:44,197 --> 00:47:45,615
while they're changing things.

474
00:47:46,533 --> 00:47:49,035
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:47:49,077 --> 00:47:50,412
It happened to me.

476
00:47:51,079 --> 00:47:52,956
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:47:54,124 --> 00:47:56,459
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:47:56,459 --> 00:47:57,919
But that's OK.

479
00:47:57,919 --> 00:47:59,129
I figured a way out.

480
00:48:10,598 --> 00:48:11,808
They were here.

481
00:48:13,935 --> 00:48:15,311
Last night.

482
00:48:15,395 --> 00:48:17,605
This was to be his home.

483
00:48:20,275 --> 00:48:22,068
That was when we loved her.

484
00:48:22,110 --> 00:48:24,446
This is all well and good,

485
00:48:24,487 --> 00:48:26,489
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:48:26,489 --> 00:48:28,575
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:48:33,163 --> 00:48:35,248
And I know where to find her.

488
00:48:43,673 --> 00:48:46,968
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:48:47,010 --> 00:48:48,011
I'm sorry?

490
00:48:48,094 --> 00:48:50,138
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:48:50,180 --> 00:48:52,182
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:48:53,016 --> 00:48:55,518
I thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:48:55,602 --> 00:48:57,312
Perhaps.

494
00:48:57,354 --> 00:48:59,814
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

495
00:48:59,856 --> 00:49:01,941
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:49:01,983 --> 00:49:04,819
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:49:06,196 --> 00:49:08,782
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:49:08,823 --> 00:49:10,367
On this very spot.

499
00:49:11,868 --> 00:49:13,953
Where is your husband now?

500
00:49:13,995 --> 00:49:17,832
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:49:17,832 --> 00:49:20,710
I met my wife at this place.

502
00:49:20,710 --> 00:49:23,004
It's where I met my husband.

503
00:49:23,046 --> 00:49:24,547
Small world.

504
00:50:18,685 --> 00:50:19,686
Hello?

505
00:51:06,983 --> 00:51:08,902
What are you doing here?

506
00:51:08,943 --> 00:51:10,570
I've been following you.

507
00:51:14,491 --> 00:51:16,159
Hold it right there!

508
00:51:18,286 --> 00:51:19,245
Johnny?

509
00:51:22,332 --> 00:51:23,667
It's been so damn long,

510
00:51:23,667 --> 00:51:25,835
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
00:51:27,003 --> 00:51:28,463
You son of a gun!

512
00:51:31,841 --> 00:51:33,093
Uncle Karl...

513
00:51:36,179 --> 00:51:37,180
Wait.

514
00:51:40,016 --> 00:51:42,185
-Is that me?
-Yeah.

515
00:51:50,485 --> 00:51:52,195
Shell Beach is where
I grew up?

516
00:51:52,278 --> 00:51:54,864
That's what I said.
Shell Beach.

517
00:51:54,948 --> 00:51:57,367
-Your home town.
-I need to get there.

518
00:51:57,367 --> 00:51:58,451
How do I get there?

519
00:51:59,869 --> 00:52:02,789
I don't know.
I haven't been there in years.

520
00:52:02,831 --> 00:52:05,709
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
00:52:07,669 --> 00:52:08,878
Sorry, Johnny.

522
00:52:10,338 --> 00:52:12,882
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
00:52:16,678 --> 00:52:20,140
-It was so bright there.
-Brighter times, I guess.

524
00:52:21,891 --> 00:52:25,186
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
00:52:25,228 --> 00:52:27,188
That's me and your Pa.

526
00:52:27,230 --> 00:52:29,566
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
00:52:29,566 --> 00:52:31,151
What happened to my parents?

528
00:52:33,695 --> 00:52:34,821
Where are they now?

529
00:52:36,072 --> 00:52:37,866
They're dead, Johnny.

530
00:52:37,907 --> 00:52:40,660
They died when the house
burned down.

531
00:52:40,702 --> 00:52:42,328
I looked after you.

532
00:52:43,246 --> 00:52:44,998
You don't remember that,
really?

533
00:52:47,834 --> 00:52:50,337
What's that? What is that?

534
00:52:56,176 --> 00:52:58,053
It's a scar.

535
00:52:58,053 --> 00:53:00,388
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
00:53:05,935 --> 00:53:07,520
What does it mean?

537
00:53:07,562 --> 00:53:09,564
It means these are all lies!

538
00:53:13,610 --> 00:53:15,945
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
00:53:16,029 --> 00:53:18,782
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
00:53:18,865 --> 00:53:21,117
See if he was...

541
00:53:21,201 --> 00:53:23,536
capable of...

542
00:53:32,420 --> 00:53:34,255
I wanted to talk to her.

543
00:53:34,297 --> 00:53:36,257
I thought she could
help me find him.

544
00:53:37,967 --> 00:53:39,969
I'm going to call the station.

545
00:53:56,111 --> 00:53:57,320
It's beautiful.

546
00:53:59,989 --> 00:54:02,826
It was a gift from my mother.

547
00:54:02,909 --> 00:54:04,452
She died recently.

548
00:54:05,829 --> 00:54:08,123
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
00:54:10,250 --> 00:54:11,292
I'm sorry.

550
00:54:14,963 --> 00:54:17,090
It's a funny thing, though.

551
00:54:17,132 --> 00:54:19,592
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
00:54:22,012 --> 00:54:24,472
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

553
00:54:25,974 --> 00:54:28,435
What's happening, lnspector?

554
00:54:28,476 --> 00:54:30,270
I'm not sure I know anymore.

555
00:54:34,274 --> 00:54:36,026
I left your old room
like it was.

556
00:54:37,027 --> 00:54:39,320
You can sleep here tonight.

557
00:54:39,362 --> 00:54:41,489
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
00:54:41,489 --> 00:54:44,284
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
00:54:45,368 --> 00:54:48,038
-Is that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
00:54:48,121 --> 00:54:50,540
That clock's kept perfect time
since I bought it.

561
00:54:50,540 --> 00:54:51,875
A.M. or P.M.?

562
00:54:53,543 --> 00:54:56,004
-What do you think?
-I don't understand.

563
00:54:56,004 --> 00:54:58,798
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
00:54:58,840 --> 00:55:01,343
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
00:55:03,011 --> 00:55:04,012
Get some sleep.

566
00:55:04,012 --> 00:55:06,514
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
00:55:38,588 --> 00:55:39,881
Come on...

568
00:56:00,276 --> 00:56:03,279
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
00:56:03,279 --> 00:56:05,699
I know. He's not himself.

570
00:56:05,740 --> 00:56:07,784
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

571
00:56:07,784 --> 00:56:10,078
-I'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
00:56:13,623 --> 00:56:16,960
I can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
00:56:17,752 --> 00:56:20,588
We just wanted to help.

574
00:56:27,303 --> 00:56:30,932
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
00:56:30,974 --> 00:56:34,436
If you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
00:56:35,895 --> 00:56:38,398
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
00:57:52,972 --> 00:57:57,644
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
00:58:02,482 --> 00:58:04,859
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
00:58:04,901 --> 00:58:08,488
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
00:58:08,530 --> 00:58:09,864
What are you talking about?

581
00:58:09,906 --> 00:58:12,992
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
00:58:13,034 --> 00:58:16,746
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
00:58:16,830 --> 00:58:20,875
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
00:58:20,917 --> 00:58:23,920
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
00:58:24,004 --> 00:58:28,383
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
00:58:28,425 --> 00:58:31,928
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
00:58:32,721 --> 00:58:34,889
I understand you now.

588
00:58:34,889 --> 00:58:38,518
I remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
00:58:38,560 --> 00:58:44,065
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
00:58:44,107 --> 00:58:48,611
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
00:58:49,612 --> 00:58:52,741
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
00:58:52,782 --> 00:58:55,368
We use your dead as vessels.

593
01:01:05,040 --> 01:01:06,041
Get in!

594
01:01:21,514 --> 01:01:25,435
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when I left her.

595
01:01:25,435 --> 01:01:28,521
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
01:01:28,563 --> 01:01:30,774
It must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
01:01:30,774 --> 01:01:31,775
What pictures?

598
01:01:33,276 --> 01:01:36,112
-I don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
01:01:36,196 --> 01:01:38,615
-Stop telling me lies.
-I am not telling lies!

600
01:01:38,698 --> 01:01:41,034
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
01:01:41,076 --> 01:01:46,039
I have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
01:01:46,081 --> 01:01:49,417
You think it makes sense to me?
I'm as confused as you are.

603
01:01:49,459 --> 01:01:53,380
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
01:01:53,421 --> 01:01:55,548
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
01:01:55,590 --> 01:01:57,258
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
01:01:57,801 --> 01:02:03,098
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
01:02:03,139 --> 01:02:04,766
Give me a second, will you?

608
01:02:06,726 --> 01:02:08,311
You can't remember, can you?

609
01:02:09,729 --> 01:02:12,232
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
01:02:13,441 --> 01:02:15,485
Wait. I got a better one.

611
01:02:15,568 --> 01:02:19,322
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
01:02:19,948 --> 01:02:22,909
-What do you mean?
-I just mean during the day.

613
01:02:24,119 --> 01:02:26,830
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
01:02:26,913 --> 01:02:30,625
I'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
01:02:30,667 --> 01:02:33,420
I mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:02:34,337 --> 01:02:36,131
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:02:37,924 --> 01:02:39,634
You don't, do you?

618
01:02:39,676 --> 01:02:45,181
I don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:02:45,265 --> 01:02:49,436
'Cause I've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:02:50,020 --> 01:02:52,313
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:02:52,355 --> 01:02:55,942
But listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

622
01:02:55,984 --> 01:02:58,862
It's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:02:58,945 --> 01:03:00,822
Shut up.
I've heard enough.

624
01:03:00,822 --> 01:03:03,533
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:03:14,002 --> 01:03:16,796
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:03:24,179 --> 01:03:25,138
Explain this.

627
01:03:46,993 --> 01:03:48,495
I'm so sorry.

628
01:03:49,579 --> 01:03:52,540
I never meant to hurt you.
I don't know why I did.

629
01:03:52,540 --> 01:03:54,334
I wish I could take it back.

630
01:03:55,043 --> 01:03:57,337
You didn't do it.

631
01:03:57,379 --> 01:03:59,089
This affair of yours,

632
01:03:59,089 --> 01:04:02,175
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:04:02,217 --> 01:04:03,426
I don't believe it happened.

634
01:04:03,426 --> 01:04:07,263
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:04:07,263 --> 01:04:10,433
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:04:10,433 --> 01:04:16,690
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:04:16,731 --> 01:04:19,442
And everything you remember,

638
01:04:19,526 --> 01:04:22,737
and everything I'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:04:22,779 --> 01:04:25,240
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:04:26,199 --> 01:04:27,701
But how can that be true?

641
01:04:28,284 --> 01:04:31,287
I so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:04:32,622 --> 01:04:34,958
I remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:04:36,584 --> 01:04:39,546
-I remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:04:41,131 --> 01:04:45,927
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:04:52,434 --> 01:04:53,935
I love you, John.

646
01:04:57,313 --> 01:04:59,482
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:05:01,151 --> 01:05:02,652
No, you can't.

648
01:05:31,973 --> 01:05:34,517
Inspector? Sir?

649
01:05:35,935 --> 01:05:38,646
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:05:40,982 --> 01:05:42,359
I thought you should know.

651
01:05:45,028 --> 01:05:49,366
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:05:56,289 --> 01:05:58,166
I knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:06:13,682 --> 01:06:14,808
Shoelace.

654
01:06:27,987 --> 01:06:31,157
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:06:34,577 --> 01:06:36,246
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:06:40,041 --> 01:06:41,209
Evening.

657
01:06:54,097 --> 01:06:57,684
I wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:07:00,270 --> 01:07:03,106
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:07:03,106 --> 01:07:04,107
Sleep.

660
01:07:34,637 --> 01:07:36,222
I knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:07:36,264 --> 01:07:38,767
Isn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:07:40,101 --> 01:07:42,812
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:07:46,107 --> 01:07:47,984
I come here often.

664
01:07:47,984 --> 01:07:50,570
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed some peace.

665
01:07:50,987 --> 01:07:54,074
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:07:55,075 --> 01:07:57,077
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:07:57,494 --> 01:08:00,163
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:08:00,163 --> 01:08:01,164
Right.

669
01:08:01,915 --> 01:08:06,628
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:08:06,670 --> 01:08:08,129
We all are.

671
01:08:09,798 --> 01:08:15,637
I'm sorry, but I have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:08:15,679 --> 01:08:19,683
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:08:19,683 --> 01:08:23,269
I need you to inject yourself.
It's the only way to understand.

674
01:08:23,311 --> 01:08:26,147
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:08:26,189 --> 01:08:29,818
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:08:29,859 --> 01:08:32,028
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:08:32,028 --> 01:08:34,948
I may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:08:34,989 --> 01:08:37,951
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:08:37,992 --> 01:08:40,495
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:08:41,705 --> 01:08:45,625
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:08:47,335 --> 01:08:50,463
All the answers you've been
looking for, I swear to you.

682
01:08:52,382 --> 01:08:58,179
Guess I'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:08:58,179 --> 01:08:59,556
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:09:01,057 --> 01:09:04,227
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:09:04,686 --> 01:09:06,396
Shell Beach.

686
01:09:07,522 --> 01:09:10,984
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:09:19,826 --> 01:09:23,246
Won't find anything there.
I've been there--

688
01:09:23,246 --> 01:09:25,582
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:09:25,665 --> 01:09:29,336
I won't. I refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:09:29,377 --> 01:09:31,755
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:09:41,097 --> 01:09:45,560
I don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:09:50,940 --> 01:09:54,027
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:09:54,069 --> 01:09:55,862
Don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

694
01:09:55,904 --> 01:09:57,614
It doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:10:04,537 --> 01:10:05,538
What?

696
01:10:08,917 --> 01:10:10,460
Who are you people?

697
01:10:10,877 --> 01:10:13,630
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:10:14,964 --> 01:10:17,592
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:10:18,760 --> 01:10:21,096
-Anna.
-I'm not Anna.

700
01:10:22,764 --> 01:10:24,808
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:10:29,062 --> 01:10:31,898
I have another use
for her first.

702
01:10:41,408 --> 01:10:43,284
I call them Strangers.

703
01:10:43,827 --> 01:10:46,329
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:10:47,497 --> 01:10:51,960
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:10:51,960 --> 01:10:54,671
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:10:54,671 --> 01:10:57,340
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:10:57,841 --> 01:11:00,677
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:11:00,760 --> 01:11:03,513
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:11:03,930 --> 01:11:07,350
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:11:07,350 --> 01:11:11,855
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:11:11,855 --> 01:11:16,151
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:11:16,192 --> 01:11:18,028
even a lost wallet.

713
01:11:18,111 --> 01:11:20,196
Then they observe the results.

714
01:11:21,489 --> 01:11:25,660
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:11:26,161 --> 01:11:29,706
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:11:29,789 --> 01:11:34,336
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:11:35,003 --> 01:11:37,547
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:11:37,630 --> 01:11:39,049
You happened to wake up...

719
01:11:39,049 --> 01:11:41,885
while I was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:11:41,968 --> 01:11:43,887
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:11:44,012 --> 01:11:48,141
It is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:11:48,183 --> 01:11:50,018
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:11:50,018 --> 01:11:52,520
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:11:52,520 --> 01:11:55,231
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:11:55,231 --> 01:11:59,736
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:11:59,736 --> 01:12:04,657
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:12:04,699 --> 01:12:07,702
-They think we can save them.
-Where do I fit in?

728
01:12:07,744 --> 01:12:12,248
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:12:17,212 --> 01:12:20,674
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:12:20,715 --> 01:12:23,927
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:12:24,010 --> 01:12:26,888
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:12:26,930 --> 01:12:30,433
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:12:31,226 --> 01:12:33,853
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:12:33,895 --> 01:12:37,065
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:12:37,107 --> 01:12:38,566
Why do they need you?

736
01:12:38,608 --> 01:12:40,568
When they first brought us here,

737
01:12:40,568 --> 01:12:44,906
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:12:44,948 --> 01:12:46,866
remixed it like paint...

739
01:12:46,908 --> 01:12:49,411
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:12:49,452 --> 01:12:53,081
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:12:54,791 --> 01:12:59,796
I understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:12:59,796 --> 01:13:03,425
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:13:03,466 --> 01:13:04,926
because they needed them.

744
01:13:04,968 --> 01:13:07,387
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:13:15,979 --> 01:13:20,442
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:13:20,483 --> 01:13:23,737
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:13:24,612 --> 01:13:26,656
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:13:27,907 --> 01:13:31,995
What about this?
This was blank when I found it.

749
01:13:31,995 --> 01:13:35,915
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:13:35,957 --> 01:13:37,250
Not in this place.

751
01:13:37,292 --> 01:13:40,170
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:13:40,170 --> 01:13:42,005
as it is with all of us.

753
01:13:42,088 --> 01:13:44,591
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:13:44,632 --> 01:13:46,134
You say they brought us here.

755
01:13:48,511 --> 01:13:49,512
From where?

756
01:13:53,350 --> 01:13:56,519
I'm sorry. I don't remember.

757
01:13:57,354 --> 01:14:01,608
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:14:01,649 --> 01:14:05,195
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:14:23,004 --> 01:14:26,716
I've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:14:26,800 --> 01:14:27,717
Let's go.

761
01:15:13,179 --> 01:15:15,432
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:15:16,725 --> 01:15:18,852
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:15:20,437 --> 01:15:22,939
The only place home exists...

764
01:15:25,191 --> 01:15:26,776
is in your head.

765
01:15:38,204 --> 01:15:39,205
Stop!

766
01:15:52,302 --> 01:15:53,303
Please!

767
01:16:14,157 --> 01:16:16,284
Now you know the truth.

768
01:17:15,844 --> 01:17:18,513
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:17:18,555 --> 01:17:20,849
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:17:20,890 --> 01:17:22,058
What do I care?

771
01:17:22,559 --> 01:17:24,644
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:17:24,686 --> 01:17:29,357
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:17:29,399 --> 01:17:33,653
I have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:17:35,572 --> 01:17:39,159
Shall I end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:17:42,704 --> 01:17:48,001
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:17:50,211 --> 01:17:51,171
Sleep.

777
01:17:53,340 --> 01:17:54,257
Now.

778
01:18:13,610 --> 01:18:14,611
Sleep.

779
01:18:23,620 --> 01:18:25,038
Kill him.

780
01:18:25,080 --> 01:18:26,081
Kill him !

781
01:18:36,633 --> 01:18:40,095
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:18:40,136 --> 01:18:43,473
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:18:43,473 --> 01:18:46,643
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:18:46,726 --> 01:18:50,647
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:18:50,730 --> 01:18:53,483
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:18:53,566 --> 01:18:56,945
The time for study is over.

787
01:18:56,945 --> 01:19:01,282
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:19:08,123 --> 01:19:11,459
It is time, Doctor. Imprint.

789
01:19:14,129 --> 01:19:16,297
Shut it down!

790
01:19:17,173 --> 01:19:19,634
Shut it down forever.

791
01:19:34,274 --> 01:19:35,358
What are you doing?

792
01:19:36,276 --> 01:19:40,989
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:19:42,032 --> 01:19:44,284
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:19:44,325 --> 01:19:46,494
so they can share your soul.

795
01:19:46,536 --> 01:19:48,872
But I've got other plans.

796
01:19:52,208 --> 01:19:55,128
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:19:55,170 --> 01:19:59,799
I'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:20:10,894 --> 01:20:12,645
Remember, John.

799
01:20:13,646 --> 01:20:15,690
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:20:15,732 --> 01:20:18,193
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:20:19,527 --> 01:20:20,487
Remember.

802
01:20:21,863 --> 01:20:24,699
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:20:24,741 --> 01:20:27,994
Now, remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:20:28,370 --> 01:20:29,704
John, remember.

805
01:20:29,913 --> 01:20:32,707
You're probably wondering why I
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:20:32,749 --> 01:20:35,168
It's because I have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:20:35,210 --> 01:20:39,172
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:20:39,214 --> 01:20:42,342
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:20:45,178 --> 01:20:49,849
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:20:49,891 --> 01:20:51,434
And you will prevail.

811
01:20:52,102 --> 01:20:53,228
Remember.

812
01:20:53,937 --> 01:20:56,189
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:20:59,109 --> 01:21:03,238
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day I'll work for you.

814
01:21:03,863 --> 01:21:07,450
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:21:07,534 --> 01:21:09,285
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:21:09,285 --> 01:21:12,580
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:21:12,622 --> 01:21:17,210
I know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:21:19,254 --> 01:21:20,463
Something's wrong.

819
01:21:29,264 --> 01:21:31,141
There is no time for romance.

820
01:21:31,141 --> 01:21:33,268
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:21:34,269 --> 01:21:35,311
What have you done?

822
01:21:36,438 --> 01:21:38,565
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:21:38,648 --> 01:21:40,567
but you must act now.

824
01:26:24,851 --> 01:26:29,105
I knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:26:29,189 --> 01:26:31,441
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:26:32,609 --> 01:26:37,072
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:26:37,072 --> 01:26:39,366
-So give her back her memories.
-I can't.

828
01:26:39,407 --> 01:26:43,453
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:26:44,287 --> 01:26:45,288
I'm sorry.

830
01:26:46,706 --> 01:26:48,625
What are you going to do now?

831
01:26:51,628 --> 01:26:53,129
I'm gonna fix things.

832
01:26:54,798 --> 01:26:58,093
You told me I had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:26:59,052 --> 01:27:01,971
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

834
01:27:03,056 --> 01:27:05,100
Make this world
anything I want it to be.

835
01:27:06,309 --> 01:27:10,397
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:28:34,064 --> 01:28:35,315
Where are you going?

837
01:28:38,735 --> 01:28:39,736
Shell Beach.

838
01:29:21,111 --> 01:29:22,612
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:29:29,411 --> 01:29:31,121
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:29:32,455 --> 01:29:33,456
Thank you.

841
01:30:19,461 --> 01:30:21,421
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:30:22,130 --> 01:30:26,426
-What are you doing?
-I'm just making a few changes.

843
01:30:26,468 --> 01:30:31,348
-We're sure that's what we want?
-I'll take my chances.

844
01:30:31,431 --> 01:30:37,187
I'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:30:37,270 --> 01:30:39,439
But I wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:30:41,149 --> 01:30:42,776
How you feel.

847
01:30:42,859 --> 01:30:45,528
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

848
01:30:45,528 --> 01:30:49,657
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:30:49,699 --> 01:30:52,869
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:30:53,995 --> 01:30:57,791
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:30:59,376 --> 01:31:01,211
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:32:40,435 --> 01:32:42,228
It's so beautiful here.

853
01:32:47,650 --> 01:32:48,943
So bright.

854
01:32:55,241 --> 01:32:57,285
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:32:57,994 --> 01:33:00,413
I think that's it over there.

856
01:33:18,640 --> 01:33:20,642
I'm headed that way myself.

857
01:33:22,644 --> 01:33:23,978
Would you like to join me?

858
01:33:27,148 --> 01:33:28,108
Sure.

859
01:33:33,530 --> 01:33:37,117
I'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?
